dk.itu.team7.game

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • dk.itu.team7.game.GameController

  • public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the main class of the game. It creates instances of View and Board, and runs the game as long as it is not terminated by the user.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Team 7: Mads Gade & Rene A. Nielsen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameController()
      This constructor runs startGame() and runGame(), when an instance of GameController is created.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isThereAWinner()
      This returns true if a player counter reaches 5.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This is the main method.
      void runGame()
      This method runs the game, as long as no winner is found.
      void startGame()
      This method creates a new instance of Board, runs setupBoard and creates View with the newly created Board as parameter.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameController

        public GameController()
               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This constructor runs startGame() and runGame(), when an instance of GameController is created.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This is the main method. It makes sure an instance of GameController is created, when the game is started.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        This method creates a new instance of Board, runs setupBoard and creates View with the newly created Board as parameter.

      • runGame

        public void runGame()
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This method runs the game, as long as no winner is found. When a winner is found, the score is updated one last time and the user is asked to restart or quit the game.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • isThereAWinner

        public boolean isThereAWinner()
        This returns true if a player counter reaches 5. When true is returned, the game is stopped.
        Returns:
        a boolean which describes whether there is a winner or not.
